articles.headline: Oil Industry Says Biofuel Push May Hurt at Pump
articles.snippet: Some executives warn that current fuel shortages could become a long-term problem, leading to higher gas prices.
articles.abstract: Some executives warn that current fuel shortages could become a long-term problem, leading to higher gas prices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gas prices are spiking again — to an average of $3.22 a gallon, and close to $4 a gallon in many areas.

articles.headline: Snubbed by U.S., China Finds New Space Partners
articles.snippet: Beijing is trying to position itself as a space benefactor to countries whose natural resources it covets here on earth.
articles.abstract: Beijing is trying to position itself as a space benefactor to countries whose natural resources it covets here on earth.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING, May 23  For years, China has chafed at efforts by the United States to exclude it from full membership in the world’s elite space club. So lately China seems to have hit on a solution: create a new club.

articles.headline: China Talks Don’t Resolve Major Issues
articles.snippet: The Bush administration failed to achieve an increase in the ownership ceilings that the Chinese impose on joint ventures with American firms, officials said.
articles.abstract: The Bush administration failed to achieve an increase in the ownership ceilings that the Chinese impose on joint ventures with American firms, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 23 — Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. and a team of cabinet members unveiled limited accords Wednesday with their Chinese counterparts to open markets in China but made little progress on major disputes over trade and currency.

articles.headline: A Japanese Export: Talent
articles.snippet: Japan’s once vaunted electronics industry has downsized to survive global competition, and is inadvertently setting off a brain drain.
articles.abstract: Japan’s once vaunted electronics industry has downsized to survive global competition, and is inadvertently setting off a brain drain.
articles.lead_paragraph: HSINCHU, Taiwan — One of the hottest exports from Japan these days isn’t video games or eco-friendly cars.

articles.headline: Years Ago, Agency Was Warned of a Drug’s Risks
articles.snippet: A leading diabetes doctor sent the Food and Drug Administration a letter seven years ago that warned of the heart risks of the drug Avandia.
articles.abstract: A leading diabetes doctor sent the Food and Drug Administration a letter seven years ago that warned of the heart risks of the drug Avandia.
articles.lead_paragraph: A leading diabetes doctor sent the Food and Drug Administration a letter seven years ago that warned of the heart risks of the drug Avandia. And in the next year, the F.D.A. reprimanded the drug’s maker for playing down safety concerns, according to documents from 2000 and 2001.
articles.byline: By Stephanie Saul and Gardiner Harris

articles.headline: Big Law Firm Won’t Face Criminal Charges in Tax Case
articles.snippet: Federal prosecutors said they had decided not to charge Sidley Austin because the firm’s questionable tax-shelter work was primarily carried out by a single person.
articles.abstract: Federal prosecutors said they had decided not to charge Sidley Austin because the firm’s questionable tax-shelter work was primarily carried out by a single person.
articles.lead_paragraph: A ruling by a federal appeals court yesterday could jeopardize a criminal case against former employees of the accounting firm KPMG — a case that has been cited by prosecutors as the showpiece of a broad investigation into the sale of questionable tax shelters that helped wealthy investors evade billions of dollars in taxes.

articles.headline: Hispanic Hopeful for ’08 Confronts Immigration
articles.snippet: Gov. Bill Richardson, Democrat of New Mexico, has weathered the crosscurrents of the immigration battle.
articles.abstract: Gov. Bill Richardson, Democrat of New Mexico, has weathered the crosscurrents of the immigration battle.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 23 — Of all the candidates running for president, none have weathered more crosscurrents of the immigration battle than Gov. Bill Richardson, the New Mexico Democrat.

articles.headline: How to Make Your Cellphone Act Like a BlackBerry
articles.snippet: Three new services from Google, Yahoo and Teleflip can forward e-mail to ordinary cellphones.
articles.abstract: Three new services from Google, Yahoo and Teleflip can forward e-mail to ordinary cellphones.
articles.lead_paragraph: When you whip out a BlackBerry or a Treo in public, what does it say about you?
